Misread smear tests that allowed woman’s incurable cancer ‘extremely unfortunate’, HDC finds https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/misread-smear-tests-that-allowed-womans-incurable-cancer-extremely-unfortunate-hdc-finds/BSUTJZZOIFBGPAFHBPOXYBTYOM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/misread-smear-tests-that-allowed-womans-incurable-cancer-extremely-unfortunate-hdc-finds/BSUTJZZOIFBGPAFHBPOXYBTYOM/ Nicholas JonesPippa van Paauwe’s smear tests were incorrectly assessed as normal, two consecutive times. Mon, 22 Jul 2024 02:00:00 +0000 Pippa van Paauwe, 40, has stage 4 cervical cancer. This developed after two of her previous smear tests were misread, due to human error. Photographed at home in September 2023 with her husband JD, and children Jarvis and Bea. Photo / Sylvie Whinray
CrowdStrike chaos: What to do on your first day back at work https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/crowdstrike-chaos-what-to-do-on-your-first-day-back-at-work/UZEJC62LERGK5CW2QXFBYPBN6Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/crowdstrike-chaos-what-to-do-on-your-first-day-back-at-work/UZEJC62LERGK5CW2QXFBYPBN6Q/ Chris KeallThat tiny percentage included your bank and your supermarket. Sun, 21 Jul 2024 22:39:28 +0000 Microsoft noted that the faulty CrowdStrike update hit "less than 1%" of Windows PCs. But given the cyber security firm's critical services focus, that 1% included banks, supermarkets, emergency services and airlines.

Photo / Getty Images
